Judul: NUMERICAL ANALYSIS AND OPTIMIZATION OF TORSIONAL CRUSHING BEHAVIOUR OF MULTI-CELL THIN-WALLED COLUMN
Abstrak:
Transportation has become an important part of human life. In the means of
increasing the safety and efficiency of transportations, most of today's vehicle uses
a spaceframe structure configured in a thin-walled lightweight structure that can
absorb the energy of an impact through a progressive buckling, bending collapse,
and also torsional collapse. This research's primary objective is to design and
optimize a thin-walled column structure with a multi-cell cross-section subjected to
torsional loading to improve its crashworthiness performance. This research studies
the influence of multi-cell cross-section on the torsional crushing performance of
thin-walled columns and estimates the optimum configuration with respect to
specific initial torsional crushing and specific energy absorption performance.
The base model of the thin-walled column is obtained from the previous
study. The thin-walled column is modified into several variations with
configuration based on the L16 orthogonal array. The optimum configuration is
then estimated using Taguchi’s Robust Parameter method and the influence of the
controlled variable on the system performance is analyzed using the ANOVA
method. The results show that the optimum configuration for specific initial
torsional crushing and specific energy absorption performance is multi-cell 2 (M2), 4.5 mm thickness, 85 mm width, 270 mm length, and AA6061 T6 thin-walled
column material. From the ANOVA method, it is determined that material is the
most influential parameter and cross-section comes in second for both specific
initial torsional crushing and specific energy absorption performance.
Kontributor / Dosen Pembimbing: Dr. Ir. Sigit Puji Santosa, M.SME.
Kata Kunci: crashworthiness, thin-walled column, multi-cell, torsional crushing, Taguchi Method, ANOVA
